# Readings

Mandatory readings for this week are:

-   Gasper, J. T., & Reeves, A. (2011). Make it rain? Retrospection and the attentive electorate in the context of natural disasters. American Journal of Political Science, 55(2), 340-355. \[[Download via ILIAS](https://ilias.uni-mannheim.de/goto.php?target=file_1368420_download&client_id=ILIAS)\]

-   Healy, A., & Malhotra, N. (2009). Myopic voters and natural disaster policy. American Political Science Review, 103(3), 387-406. \[[Download via ILIAS](https://ilias.uni-mannheim.de/goto.php?target=file_1368421_download&client_id=ILIAS)\]

Further readings and materials include:

-   Bechtel, M. M., & Hainmueller, J. (2011). How lasting is voter gratitude? An analysis of the short‐and long‐term electoral returns to beneficial policy. American journal of political science, 55(4), 852-868.

-   Cole, S., Healy, A., & Werker, E. (2012). Do voters demand responsive governments? Evidence from Indian disaster relief. Journal of Development Economics, 97(2), 167-181.
